text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

text: Buy the ticket, take the ride.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: You only live once, but if you do it right once is enough.
author: Mae West

text: Above all, try something.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: I never worry about the future. It comes soon enough.
author: Albert Einstein

text: One who makes no mistakes makes nothing at all.
author: Giacomo Casanova

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: In the end, it’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: If I’d followed all the rules, I’d never have gotten anywhere.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Action expresses priorities.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

text: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Life is short and unpredictable. You might as well laugh, smile, and enjoy it.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Don’t count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

text: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: It’s not the years in life that count. It’s the life in your years.
author: Edward J. Stieglitz

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: If you want something you never had, you must be willing to do something you’ve never done.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Leap, and the net will appear.
author: John Burroughs

text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn’t do than by the ones you did do.
author: Mark Twain

text: Life is what happens when you’re busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: Dream as if you’ll live forever. Live as if you’ll die today.
author: James Dean

text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.

text: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.

text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.

text: You can’t go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.

text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.

text: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.

text: Chase the vision, not the money; the money will end up following you.

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Action expresses priorities.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Think big and don’t listen to people who tell you it can’t be done. Life’s too short to think small.
author: Tim Ferriss

text: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
author: Sean Patrick Flanery

text: Stop being afraid of what could go wrong and start being excited about what could go right.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Life’s too mysterious to take too serious.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Confucius

text: Challenges are gifts that force us to search for a new center of gravity. Don’t fight them. Just find a new way to stand.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The best dreams happen when you’re awake.
author: Cherie Gilderbloom

text: Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
author: Mother Teresa

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
author: Anonymous

text: Not all who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Happiness is not by chance, but by choice.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: Don’t be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: You have within you right now, everything you need to deal with whatever the world can throw at you.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving.
author: Conrad Hilton

text: It’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

text: Don’t limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
author: Jerry Dunn

text: Life’s too short to wait.
author: Unknown

text: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A.A. Milne

text: The journey not the arrival matters.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Go out on a limb. That’s where the fruit is.
author: Jimmy Carter

text: Stay foolish to stay sane.
author: Maxime Lagacé

text: Live for today, plan for tomorrow, party tonight.
author: Unknown

text: The best way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Life is short, make it count.
author: Anonymous

text: Live your life by a compass, not a clock.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: Be fearless in the pursuit of what sets your soul on fire.
author: Jennifer Lee

text: Take the risk or lose the chance.
author: Anonymous

text: Make each day your masterpiece.
author: John Wooden

text: Life isn’t about waiting for the storm to pass, it’s about learning how to dance in the rain.
author: Vivian Greene

text: A ship is safe in harbor, but that’s not what ships are built for.
author: John A. Shedd

text: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
author: Robert Byrne

text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
author: Les Brown

text: If you want to fly give up everything that weighs you down.
author: Buddha

text: Adventure is worthwhile.
author: Aesop

text: In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
author: Coco Chanel

text: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: To live will be an awfully big adventure.
author: Peter Pan

text: Live each day as if your life had just begun.
author: Goethe

text: Life is short, do stuff that matters.
author: Unknown

text: It’s not about having time. It’s about making time.
author: Unknown

text: The only way around is through.
author: Robert Frost

text: Dream big. Work hard. Stay focused.
author: Unknown

text: You don’t have to be perfect to be amazing.
author: Unknown

text: Life is tough, but so are you.
author: Unknown

text: Choose to shine.
author: Unknown

text: Believe in yourself.
author: Unknown

text: Do it with passion or not at all.
author: Rosa Nouchette Carey

text: Be the energy you want to attract.
author: Unknown

text: Live without regrets.
author: Unknown

text: Stay curious, stay humble.
author: Unknown

text: Collect moments, not things.
author: Unknown

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: The best is yet to come.
author: Unknown

text: Your vibe attracts your tribe.
author: Unknown

text: Fortune favors the bold.
author: Virgil

text: Life is short, have fun.
author: Unknown

text: Embrace uncertainty.
author: Unknown

text: Make today amazing.
author: Unknown

text: Choose joy.
author: Unknown

text: Live without limits.
author: Unknown

text: Seek adventures that open your mind.
author: Unknown

text: Dare to be different.
author: Unknown

text: Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Be present in all things.
author: Unknown

text: Take the road less traveled.
author: Robert Frost

text: Be bold. Be brave. Be you.
author: Unknown

text: Follow your heart.
author: Unknown

text: Every day is a second chance.
author: Unknown

text: Stay wild.
author: Unknown

text: Find beauty in the small things.
author: Unknown

text: Be your own kind of beautiful.
author: Unknown

text: Do more of what makes you happy.
author: Unknown

text: Life’s an adventure, enjoy the ride.
author: Unknown

text: Never stop exploring.
author: Unknown

text: Choose to be happy.
author: Unknown

text: Seek what sets your soul on fire.
author: Unknown

text: Be a voice, not an echo.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Collect moments, not things.
author: Unknown

text: Your only limit is you.
author: Unknown

text: Live a life you will remember.
author: Unknown

text: Life is a gift, unwrap it with joy.
author: Unknown

text: Choose adventure over comfort.
author: Unknown

text: Stay hungry. Stay foolish.
author: Steve Jobs

text: You are capable of amazing things.
author: Unknown

text: Journey over destination.
author: Unknown

text: Be fearless in the pursuit of what sets your soul on fire.
author: Anonymous

text: Live life with no excuses, travel with no regret.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Adventure awaits.
author: Unknown

text: Create your own sunshine.
author: Unknown

text: Life is better when you’re laughing.
author: Unknown

text: Be a warrior, not a worrier.
author: Unknown

text: The sky’s not the limit, your mind is.
author: Unknown

text: Life is short. Do something amazing today.
author: Unknown

text: Seek respect, not attention. It lasts longer.
author: Ziad K. Abdelnour

text: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
author: Suzy Kassem

text: The pain you feel today will be the strength you feel tomorrow.
author: Anonymous

text: Your time is now.
author: Unknown

text: Nothing worth having comes easy.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Don’t wait for opportunity. Create it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Rise up and attack the day with enthusiasm.
author: Unknown

text: The best view comes after the hardest climb.
author: Anonymous

text: Make every day count.
author: Anonymous
